snippet: TISHMAN--John L. The Board of Trustees and staff of Carnegie Hall mourn the passing of our dear friend and colleague John L. Tishman, a longtime Carnegie Hall Trustee and a true giant in New York's construction industry. John joined the Carnegie Hall Board of Trustees in 1987 and served the Hall with devotion for nearly two decades. John was the visionary chairman and CEO of Tishman Realty & Construction Co., Inc., which has played a central role in virtually all of Carnegie Hall's major capital projects, beginning with the historic renovation and restoration of Carnegie Hall, completed in 1986, and continuing with the Hall's expansion into the adjacent Carnegie Hall Tower, completed in 1990; the construction of Judy and Arthur Zankel Hall, completed in 2003; and the renovation of Carnegie Hall's Studio Towers, completed in 2014. John will forever occupy a very special place in Carnegie Hall's history. We express heartfelt condolences to his son Daniel and his daughter Katherine, and to the entire Tishman family and their loved ones. Sanford I. Weill, President; Mercedes T. Bass, Acting Chairman; Clive Gillinson, Executive/Artistic Director 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  TISHMAN, JOHN L
